header.title: The Scroll of Set - December 1990
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Setianism, Black Magic

central_thesis: The Scroll of Set emphasizes individual self-actualization (Xeper) through conscious will, reframing traditional occult practices like astrology and ritual as tools for discernment and deliberate manipulation of reality. It posits that true free will arises from self-knowledge and the conscious shaping of one's destiny, rather than being negated by fate, and details the structural and operative principles of Setian Greater Black Magic.

structure_content.chapter_title: Astrology and the Æon of Set
structure_content.summary: This article redefines astrology from a Setian perspective, moving beyond fatalism to present it as a tool for self-discovery and understanding 'givens' in one's life. It explores the relationship between free will, memory, genetic programming, and future selves, viewing Leviathan as the 'spark of initiative' that drives potential realization through the 'Gift of Set'. The author advocates for ritual exploration of past and future selves to tune into the core being and discern future possibilities, emphasizing astrology as a discipline requiring discernment and core self-contact.

A personal reflection on the journey into the Temple of Set, acknowledging Satanism as part of the Setian heritage while differentiating it from popular misconceptions. The author describes the experience of encountering other Setians as unique, highlighting the shared characteristic of having 'stepped beyond fear of the unknown' in pursuit of truth and recognizing a profound connection among those who walk alone yet gather for mutual recognition.

This piece describes a Conclave attendee's experience with two Temple Orders: the Order of the Vampyre and the Order of Shuti. The Vampyre meeting is characterized by intense, feral, sensual, and erotic energy focused on safe involvement. The Shuti meeting emphasizes intellectual and philosophical discussions, focusing on self-definition, language precision, fostering magic in children, and integrating new techniques into magical repertoire, highlighting the order's cerebral and dialogue-driven nature.

This article provides a technical analysis of effective ritual creation, emphasizing 'working principles' and 'structure' over specific content. It uses the Black Mass as an example of manipulating existing structures for opposing purposes and details the revision of 'Das Tierdrama' from a Satanic to a Setian context. The revision shifts focus from the man=beast equation to man=god, emphasizing intellect, symbolic actions, and the exaltation of Set's name, illustrating how ritual effectiveness is achieved through conscious design and physical performance.

This commentary describes 'Direction of Influence' as a crucial element in Greater Black Magic (GBM). It involves scrutinizing individuals and their reactions to hypothetical situations to identify 'anticipatory patterns' and 'permeable areas'. The magician then crafts an environment or 'mythical authority' to manipulate these patterns, making 'adjustments' through ritual working to bring about desired outcomes. Success is dependent on understanding and manipulating both 'anticipatory patterns' and 'reality constructions' with skill and focus.

Michael Aquino's official notes on the Set-XI Conclave, offering congratulations for Recognitions, appreciation for the 'Mythic Theatre' Working (which led to renaming celestial constellations Sokaris and Nammu-Ani), and thanks to contributors like Ruth Nielsen for her workshop and Forrest J Ackerman for attending. It also highlights the Conclave's role as a platform for 'brainstorming and deliberation' that shapes Temple policy and program innovations, emphasizing the unique power and permanence of Black Magic within the Temple.

key_concepts.definition: The Setian process of self-actualization or becoming, central to individual evolution and realization of potential. It is the ultimate goal of the Gift of Set.

Conceptualized as the 'spark of initiative' that propels movement within the mechanical universe, nourishing the deep yearning for potential realization and inspiring the use of the Gift of Set. It represents continuity and ageless existence.
The innate capacity or tool within an individual to realize their potential and effect change, used in conjunction with the 'spark of initiative' (Leviathan).

A core belief that, when explored relevantly to one's self or deity, moves an individual into initiatory states. Its value lies in the personal answer it provides to 'what does this mystery do for me?' or 'how does it assist in Xeper?'

In astrology, the apparent back-and-forth motion of a planet. From a Setian perspective, actions begun during a retrograde period may not be completed or emotionally settled until the motion ends, implying a cyclical process of completion and self-knowledge.
The inner intuition or gnosis that illuminates understanding, particularly in magical and astrological discernment, guiding the Setian in their exploration of mysteries.

A form of practical magic aimed at achieving desired outcomes through conscious will and manipulation of reality. It involves identifying and leveraging 'anticipatory patterns' and 'reality constructions' in the environment.

A critical component of GBM, referring to the strategic identification and manipulation of 'permeable areas' or 'anticipatory patterns' within individuals and situations to steer events towards a desired magical outcome.

The underlying framework and working principles of a ritual, considered more important for effectiveness than specific content. Symbolic actions and overall sequence are key, allowing the structure to be adapted for any magical aim.

A concept from the 'Das Tierdrama' ritual (German for 'Beast-Men'), representing the man=beast equation. In the Setian revision, this concept is transcended towards a man=god ideal, emphasizing intellectual and spiritual elevation.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined in the Scroll is centered on individual Xeper, achieved through the conscious exercise of will and self-knowledge. It integrates philosophical understanding with operative magical techniques, framing practices like astrology as tools for discernment rather than prediction. The core mechanics involve identifying the 'givens' of one's existence (e.g., genetic programming), understanding their origins, and then willfully manipulating them through conscious action. Greater Black Magic (GBM) is presented as a method to influence external reality by analyzing and shaping 'anticipatory patterns' and 'reality constructions' in individuals and environments. Rituals are designed based on 'working principles' and symbolic actions, with a focus on intellectual transformation and the projection of will to achieve specific magical aims.
tools: Astrology (used for discernment and understanding 'givens', not fortune-telling)
Tarot and Numerology (for insight, alongside astrology)
Symbolic Actions (more important than spoken words in ritual effectiveness)
Essential Oils (used in GBM for charging and anointing)
Analysis of 'Anticipatory Patterns' and 'Reality Constructions' (for 'Direction of Influence' in GBM)
rituals: Ritual Exploration of Past and Future Selves (for self-knowledge and discernment)
Greater Black Magic (GBM) Workings (e.g., Conclave working using essential oils and will projection)
Revised 'Das Tierdrama' (a structured ritual emphasizing intellectual transformation and the exaltation of Set's name, shifting from man=beast to man=god)

relevant_quotes.text: What does this mystery do for me? The Setian means: 'How does this mystery assist in my process of self-discovery, self-actualization, or Xeper?'

I think of Leviathan as the spark of initiative that keeps everything moving along in the mechanical universe, and that nourishes the deep yearning within to realize our potential, thus inspiring us to use the Gift of Set.
The basic fear expressed by most of us is the loss of free will. I think therein lies the answer to the future selves' nature.

It is true that we often delude ourselves into thinking that a willful act is truly willful when in fact it is an impulsive action related to genetic programming. But to the aware Setian such an act can be willful if it is done with knowledge of the impulse and the consequences.
It is the great fortune of all the Initiates of the Temple of Set to have access to the works and Words of the Magi in our midst.
There is a great secret to the creation of effective rituals - that they must be created according to working principles.
The overall sequence of steps is also essential, of course. The symbolic actions are often more important to the effectiveness of the working than are the words spoken during the ritual.
Direction of influence is one of the most important elements in determining success in a Black Magical operation.

The Black Magician alone must take the first steps in formulating a picture of his or her universe. But in striving to improve this picture, and changing it, do not neglect the work already done, both by avowed magicians and by secular students of human nature.

critical_analysis.relevance: The Scroll of Set provides foundational insights into the Temple of Set's unique approach to magic and philosophy. It clarifies key concepts like Xeper and Leviathan within a practical framework, challenging conventional occult interpretations of fate and free will. The detailed discussion of ritual structure and 'Direction of Influence' offers a technically precise view of Setian Black Magic as an operative system for personal and environmental transformation, distinguishing it from other esoteric traditions by its emphasis on conscious will and self-knowledge as the primary magical force. It positions Setian magic as a rigorous discipline requiring deep self-awareness and discernment.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Primarily Initiates of the Temple of Set seeking to deepen their understanding of its philosophy, magical theory, and practical applications. Secondarily, it serves academic researchers and practitioners of Western Esotericism and Occultism interested in modern magical orders, Setianism, and the intersection of psychology, biology, and magical practice. It assumes familiarity with basic occult terminology and Temple of Set concepts.
